data.text:
“TMS For Healthcare Professionals: An Alternative Treatment for Clinically Resistant Depression” (1.0 CE hour )

Drew Davis, LCSW

Clinical Director – Telos Residential Center

Drew Davis, LCSW, is the Clinical Director at Telos Residential Treatment Center. He graduated with his BSW from Weber State University, and his MSW from Brigham Young University. He specializes in Neurofeedback, EMDR, PrTMS and resilience building within treatment.

John Hall, LMFT

Director of Research & CQO

John is the Director of Research and Chief Quality Officer for Telos. He is the Executive Director for Telos Neuro Health. He is also a partner at Telos U and Telos Anthem House. He has degrees in Psychology from Brigham Young University and Marriage and Family Therapy from Abilene Christian University and a certificate from the Mental Research Institute. He has published in multiple journals including the Journal of Therapeutic Schools and Programs and is now a member of the editorial board of JTSP having served previously as guest editor for that journal. He has published a chapter in a textbook for marriage and family therapy graduate coursework. He is the chair of the research committee for the National Association of Therapeutic Schools and Programs (NATSAP) and has given many presentations at NATSAP, YATA, IECA and other conferences.

Learning Objectives:

1. Understand the research supporting TMS as a treatment for Depression

2 Understand the multiple types of TMS that can be used and what sets them each apart

3. Understand the process of qualifying for insurance coverage for TMS

Wednesday, January 19th, 2022

12:00 PM – 1:00 PM

This CEU will be conducted using the Zoom online platform, attendance for current UTAHSWA members is free.

There is a $5 regsitration fee for non-members of the UTAHSWA payable via our website or Venmo
